unnormalised: Mumbai – Indian manufacturers are increasingly turning to sophisticated inventory forecasting techniques to optimize their supply chains and reduce costs. Accurate predictions of future demand, taking into account factors like seasonal festivals (Diwali, Holi) and market trends, are proving crucial for profitability.

unnormalised: Traditional methods often fail to account for unexpected disruptions, like the recent floods in Chennai on 12/12/2015, which severely impacted production. The report emphasizes the need for real-time data integration and scenario planning. Many SMEs are now attending workshops scheduled at 14:00 hrs on 26/07/2024, focused on implementing best practices. Forecasts must also consider export schedules; for instance, shipments destined for the US are planned 6 months in advance, typically finalised around 15/08. Poor forecasting can lead to stockouts or excess inventory, both detrimental to business. Modern software solutions allow adjustments even until 17:00 hrs the day before a major production run.
